text: Jeremiah Andrew Denton, Jr. (July 15, 1924 â€“ March 28, 2014) was a United States aviator and Rear Admiral, and also a United States Senator. He spent almost eight years as a Prisoner of War (PoW) in North Vietnam during the Vietnam War. He later wrote a book which became a movie about those experiences. He was born in Mobile, Alabama. Denton died from complications of a heart ailment on March 28, 2014 at a hospice in Virginia Beach, Virginia. He was 89 years old. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1924 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American admirals Category:American aviators Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War Category:American Roman Catholics Category:Politicians from Mobile, Alabama Category:Prisoners of war Category:Purple Heart recipients Category:United States senators from Alabama Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Military people from Alabama
title: Jeremiah Denton
